name: Html.Shorthand
comment:
Shorthands for common Html elements

# Conventions
The following conventions are used for shorthands. One example is provided for each.

## Single argument form
The attributes argument of the node is elided, with only the list of children remaining.
For certain elements where a canonical form is highly desirable, these functions have been left
off in order to encourage more uniform use. For example, an `img` tag will almost certainly benefit
from `src` and `alt` attributes. Some structural elements such as `section`, `aside`, `article`
and `figure` should quite likely list an `id` in order to help users target interesting portions of
your website via a URL. Other elements, such as `hr` are not included in this list simply because it
does not make sense to provide them with *any* child elements. In this case the canonical form is
also appropriate.

@docs div_

## Canonical form

This form attempts to take a common sense list of arguments. This is a limited form which
will not satisfy every need, but takes care of the extremely common cases. Many of the elements
excluded from single argument form is included here in a special form.

@docs img'

Note that `main'` is provided by elm-html, not by this package which only provides `main_`.

## Classy form

Another very common case is creating elements for mostly aesthetic reasons.
For this it is frequently convenient to specify only a `class` attribute and not much else.
These 'c'-postfixed shorthands are similar to the canonical form, but also take a class string
(a space separated list of CSS classes).

@docs divc

values.name: a'
values.comment: [<a>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a) represents a hyperlink , linking to another resource.

values.name: abbr'
values.comment:
[<abbr>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/abbr) represents an abbreviation or an acronym ; the expansion of the
abbreviation can be represented in the title attribute.

values.name: address_
values.comment:
[<address>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/address) defines a section containing contact information.

Do:
* [place inside the <footer> where appropriate](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/address#Summary)

Don't:
* [represent an arbitrary, unrelated address](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/address#Summary)

values.name: article'
values.comment:
[<article>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/article) defines self-contained content that could exist independently of the rest
of the content.

Do:
* [use <article> for self-contained components with informational content](http://html5doctor.com/the-article-element/)
* [use <article> for blog entries, user-submitted comments, interactive educational gadgets](http://html5doctor.com/the-article-element/)

Don't:
* [confuse <article> with <section> which need not be self-contained](http://www.brucelawson.co.uk/2010/html5-articles-and-sections-whats-the-difference/)

values.name: aside'
values.comment:
[<aside>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/aside) defines some content loosely related to the page content. If it is removed,
the remaining content still makes sense.

values.name: audio'
values.comment:
[<audio>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/audio) represents a sound or audio stream.

Doesn't allow for <track&rt;s <source&rt;s, please use `audio` for that.

values.name: b_
values.comment:
[<b>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/b) represents a text which to which attention is drawn for utilitarian
purposes. It doesn't convey extra importance and doesn't imply an alternate
voice.

values.name: bdi_
values.comment:
[<bdi>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/bdi) represents text that must be isolated from its surrounding for
bidirectional text formatting. It allows embedding a span of text with a
different, or unknown, directionality.

values.name: blockquote_
values.comment:
[<blockquote>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/blockquote) represents a content that is quoted from another source.

The canonical form uses a cite url, but a single argument form is also provided

Don't:
* use blockquote for short, inline quotations, we have <`q'`> for that

values.name: body_
values.comment:
[<body>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/body) represents the content of an HTML document. There is only one `body`
element in a document.

values.name: br'
values.comment: [<br>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/br) represents a line break.

values.name: button_
values.comment: [<input>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input) represents a typed data field allowing the user to edit the data.

values.name: caption_
values.comment: [<caption>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/caption) represents the title of a table.

values.name: cite_
values.comment:
[<cite>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/cite) represents the title of a work.

Do:
* [consider using an anchor inside of the cite to link to the origin](http://html5doctor.com/cite-and-blockquote-reloaded/)

values.name: code_
values.comment:
[<code>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/code) represents computer code.

`code` or `code_` can be used for code that includes color highlighting.
`code'` and `codec` can be used for simple unhighlighted code fragments.

values.name: dd'
values.comment: [<dd>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dd) represents the definition of the terms immediately listed before it.

values.name: dfn'
values.comment:
[<dfn>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dfn) represents a term whose definition is contained in its nearest ancestor
content.

values.name: div_
values.comment: [<div>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/div) represents a generic container with no special meaning.

values.name: dl_
values.comment:
[<dl>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dl) defines a definition list, that is, a list of terms and their associated
definitions.

values.name: dt'
values.comment: [<dt>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dt) represents a term defined by the next `dd`.

values.name: em_
values.comment: [<em>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/em) represents emphasized text, like a stress accent.

values.name: embed'
values.comment:
[<embed>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/embed) represents a integration point for an external, often non-HTML,
application or interactive content.

values.name: embedc
values.type: ClassString -> String -> UrlString -> Int -> Int -> Html

values.name: encodeClass
values.comment:
A simplistic way of encoding of `class` attributes into a [sane format](http://stackoverflow.com/a/72577).
This is used internally by all of the shorthands that take a `ClassString`.

* Everything is turned into lowercase
* Only alpha-numeric characters (a-z,A-Z,0-9), hyphens (-) and underscores (_) are passed through the filter.
* If the first characters not a letter, 'x' will be prepended.
* Empty strings are allowed

values.name: encodeId
values.comment:
A simplistic way of encoding `id` attributes into a [sane format](http://stackoverflow.com/a/72577).
This is used internally by all of the shorthands that take an `IdString`.

* Everything is turned into lowercase
* Only alpha-numeric characters (a-z,A-Z,0-9), hyphens (-) and underscores (_) are passed through the filter.
* If the first characters not a letter, 'x' will be prepended.
* Empty strings are allowed

values.name: fieldset_
values.comment: [<fieldset>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/fieldset) represents a set of controls.

values.name: figcaption_
values.comment: [<figcaption>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/figcaption) represents the legend of a figure.

values.name: figure'
values.comment:
[<figure>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/figure) represents a figure illustrated as part of the document.

Do:
* [use figure for captioned content](http://html5doctor.com/the-figure-figcaption-elements/)
* [use figure for things other than images: video, audio, a chart, a table etc](http://html5doctor.com/the-figure-figcaption-elements/)

Don't:
* [turn every image into a figure](http://html5doctor.com/avoiding-common-html5-mistakes/#figure)

values.name: footer_
values.comment:
[<footer>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/footer) defines the footer for a page or section. It often contains a copyright
notice, some links to legal information, or addresses to give feedback.

values.name: form_
values.comment:
[<form>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/form) represents a form , consisting of controls, that can be submitted to a
server for processing.

values.name: formc
values.type: ClassString -> String -> String -> List Html -> Html

values.name: h1'
values.comment:
[<h*>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements) provide titles for sections and subsections, describing the topic it introduces.

Do:
* [use headings to define a document outline](http://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/2013/10/html5-document-outline/)
* [try to have only one first level heading on a page](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements)
* [introduce <section>s with headings](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements)

Don't:
* [skip heading levels if you can help it](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements)
* [style headings using html5 <section>s](http://www.stubbornella.org/content/2011/09/06/style-headings-using-html5-sections/)

values.name: header_
values.comment:
[<header>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/header) defines the header of a page or section. It often contains a logo, the
title of the web site, and a navigational table of content.

Don't:
* [overuse <header>](http://html5doctor.com/avoiding-common-html5-mistakes/#header-hgroup)

values.name: hr'
values.comment:
[<hr>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/hr) represents a thematic break between paragraphs of a section or article or
any longer content.

No class'y form is provided to prevent abuse.

values.name: i_
values.comment:
[<i>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/i) represents some text in an alternate voice or mood, or at least of
different quality, such as a taxonomic designation, a technical term, an
idiomatic phrase, a thought, or a ship name.

values.name: iframe'
values.comment: [<iframe>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/iframe) embedded an HTML document.

values.name: img'
values.comment: [<ins>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ins) defines an addition to the document.

values.name: imgc
values.type: ClassString -> UrlString -> Int -> Int -> String -> Html

values.name: kbd_
values.comment:
[<kbd>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/kbd) represents user input, often from the keyboard, but not necessarily; it
may represent other input, like transcribed voice commands.

    instructions : Html
    instructions =
        p_ 
        [ text "Press "
        , kbd_ [ kbd' "Ctrl", text "+", kbd' "S" ]
        , text " to save this document."
        ]

values.name: label_
values.comment: [<label>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/label) represents the caption of a form control.

values.name: legend'
values.comment: [<legend>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/legend) represents the caption for a `fieldset`.

values.name: li_
values.comment: [<li>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/li) defines a item of an enumeration list.

values.name: main_
values.comment:
[<main>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/main) defines the main or important content in the document. There is only one
`main` element in the document.

values.name: mark_
values.comment:
[<mark>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/mark) represents text highlighted for reference purposes, that is for its
relevance in another context.

values.name: nav_
values.comment:
[<nav>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/nav) defines a section that contains only navigation links.

Do:
* [use nav for major navigation](http://html5doctor.com/avoiding-common-html5-mistakes/#nav-external)

Don't:
* [wrap all lists of links in <nav>](http://html5doctor.com/avoiding-common-html5-mistakes/#nav-external)

values.name: ol_
values.comment: [<ol>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ol) defines an ordered list of items.

values.name: p_
values.comment: [<p>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/p) defines a portion that should be displayed as a paragraph of text.

values.name: param'
values.comment:
[<object>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/object) represents an external resource , which is treated as an image, an HTML
sub-document, or an external resource to be processed by a plug-in.

values.name: pre_
values.comment:
[<pre>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/pre) indicates that its content is preformatted and that this format must be
preserved.

Do:
* [use <pre> for blocks of whitespace sensitive text that must not wrap](http://stackoverflow.com/a/4611735)
* use <pre> as a wrapper for blocks <`code_`>
* use <pre> as a wrapper for blocks of <`samp_`> output from a computer program

values.name: q_
values.comment:
[<q>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/q) represents an inline quotation.

The canonical form uses a cite url, but the single argument is also provided.

values.name: rp'
values.comment:
[<rp>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/rp) represents parenthesis around a ruby annotation, used to display the
annotation in an alternate way by browsers not supporting the standard display
for annotations.

values.name: rt'
values.comment: [<rt>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/rt) represents the text of a ruby annotation .

values.name: ruby_
values.comment:
[<ruby>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ruby) represents content to be marked with ruby annotations, short runs of text
presented alongside the text. This is often used in conjunction with East Asian
language where the annotations act as a guide for pronunciation, like the
Japanese furigana.

values.name: s_
values.comment:
[<s>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/s) represents content that is no longer accurate or relevant.

Don't:
* [use <s> for indicating document edits, use <del> or <ins>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/s#Summary)

values.name: samp_
values.comment: [<samp>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/samp) represents the output of a program or a computer.

values.name: section'
values.comment:
[<section>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/section) defines a section in a document. Use sections to construct a document outline.

Do:
* [use <section>s to define document outlines](http://html5doctor.com/outlines/)
* [...but use headings carefully](http://www.paciellogroup.com/blog/2013/10/html5-document-outline/)

Don't:
* [use section as a wrapper for styling](http://html5doctor.com/avoiding-common-html5-mistakes/#section-wrapper)

values.name: small_
values.comment:
[<small>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/small) represents a side comment , that is, text like a disclaimer or a
copyright, which is not essential to the comprehension of the document.

Don't:
  * [use small for pure styling](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/small#Summary)

Do:
  * [use small for side-comments and small print, including copyright and legal text](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/small#Summary)

values.name: span_
values.comment:
[<bdo>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/bdo) represents the directionality of its children, in order to explicitly
override the Unicode bidirectional algorithm.

values.name: strong_
values.comment: [<strong>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/strong) represents especially important text.

values.name: sub_
values.comment: [<sub>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/sub) represent a subscript.

values.name: sup_
values.comment: [<sup>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/sup) represent a superscript.

values.name: table_
values.comment:
[<source>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/source) allows authors to specify alternative media resources for media elements
like `video` or `audio`.

values.name: tbody_
values.comment: [<colgroup>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/colgroup) represents a set of one or more columns of a table.

values.name: td_
values.comment: [<td>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/td) represents a data cell in a table.

values.name: tfoot_
values.comment: [<tfoot>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/tfoot) represents the block of rows that describes the column summaries of a table.

values.name: th_
values.comment: [<th>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/th) represents a header cell in a table.

values.name: thead_
values.comment: [<thead>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/thead) represents the block of rows that describes the column labels of a table.

values.name: time_
values.comment:
[<time>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/time) represents a date and time value; the machine-readable equivalent can be
represented in the datetime attribute.

values.name: tr_
values.comment: [<tr>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/tr) represents a row of cells in a table.

values.name: u_
values.comment:
[<u>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/u) represents a non-textual annoatation for which the conventional
presentation is underlining, such labeling the text as being misspelt or
labeling a proper name in Chinese text.

values.name: ul_
values.comment: [<ul>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/ul) defines an unordered list of items.

values.name: var'
values.comment:
[<var>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/var) represents a variable. Specific cases where it should be used include an
actual mathematical expression or programming context, an identifier
representing a constant, a symbol identifying a physical quantity, a function
parameter, or a mere placeholder in prose.

values.name: video'
values.comment:
[<video>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/video) represents a video, the associated audio and captions, and controls.

Doesn't allow for <track&rt;s <source&rt;s, please use `video` for that.

values.name: wbr'
values.comment:
[<wbr>](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/wbr) represents a line break opportunity , that is a suggested point for
wrapping text in order to improve readability of text split on several lines.
